title: How to find out what events caused spikes in Google trends data - Quora

response.answer_text: Events don’t cause spikes. Users searching for a search term cause spikes. That’s why most discussions of trends talk about correlation, not causation. Searches for “sourdough starter” have spiked during the COVID-19 pandemic. That’s correlation. If you want to know causation - “What has caused people to start searching for ‘sourdough starter?’” - you will have to conduct a survey and ask people.

Take the queries under the search term that has a spike and google it… Look at top search results for the queries and the general reason should be clear once you understand the context for what the users are searching for.
